conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the system when it is at rest to find mass ratio of A ball to C ball.
Angle θ is 30°, B ball is in contact with the bowl but experiences no normal force.
Tension in the string connected to B ball provides necessary centripetal force.
Let T be the tension in the strings.
Tension T balances the weight of the C ball: T = Mg.
Tension T balances the weight of the A ball: T = mg.
Net horizontal and vertical forces on B ball must be zero.
Vertical component of tension balances weight of B ball, horizontal component provides centripetal force.
For B ball: T cos θ = Mg.
Mass ratio of A ball to C ball is 2√3/3.
